Incident Description: Unauthorized frames detected on the powertrain CAN bus, causing intermittent engine stalling during high-speed travel.
Mitigation Strategy: Implement Message Authentication Codes (MAC) and hardware-based IDS to filter unauthorized IDs.

Incident Description: Malicious firmware update bypassed signature verification due to an expired root certificate, leading to infotainment lock.
Mitigation Strategy: Update certificate revocation lists and enforce strict hardware security module (HSM) checks.

Incident Description: Remote API vulnerability in the mobile app allowed unauthorized doors unlocking and GPS tracking of 5,000 vehicles.
Mitigation Strategy: Implement OAuth2.0 with strict scoping and rate-limiting on all telematics API endpoints.

Incident Description: Compromised third-party library in the sensor fusion module introduced a backdoor for remote code execution (RCE).
Mitigation Strategy: Perform Software Composition Analysis (SCA) and establish a Software Bill of Materials (SBOM).

Incident Description: Browser-based exploit in the head unit allowed lateral movement to the vehicle's internal gateway.
Mitigation Strategy: Sandbox the infotainment OS and physically isolate the multimedia bus from critical ECUs.

Incident Description: Spoofed "Emergency Electronic Brake Light" messages caused sudden autonomous braking in multiple nearby vehicles.
Mitigation Strategy: Enforce V2X message signing using a Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) with low-latency verification.

Incident Description: Physical access through the OBD-II port used to inject diagnostic commands that reset the odometer reading.
Mitigation Strategy: Disable non-essential diagnostic services when the vehicle is in motion; encrypt ODO storage.

Incident Description: Ransomware attack on the EVSE (Charging Station) communication protocol prevented vehicle charging.
Mitigation Strategy: Use ISO 15118 secure communication standards with TLS encryption for charging sessions.

Incident Description: Relay attack captured high-frequency signals from a key fob to gain unauthorized entry and start the vehicle.
Mitigation Strategy: Implement Ultra-Wideband (UWB) distance bounding to ensure the key is physically near the car.

Incident Description: Brute-force attack on the UDS (Unified Diagnostic Services) 0x27 Security Access service granted root access to the Body Control Module.
Mitigation Strategy: Use asymmetric challenge-response mechanisms and implement lockout timers for failed attempts.

Incident Description: Buffer overflow in the Bluetooth stack allowed an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the infotainment system.
Mitigation Strategy: Regularly patch Bluetooth drivers and utilize Address Space Layout Randomization (ASLR).

Incident Description: Rogue access point masquerading as the vehicle's default Wi-Fi captured passenger login credentials.
Mitigation Strategy: Enforce WPA3 and educate users on verifying hotspot certificates before connecting.

Incident Description: Ultrasound jammer blinded the ultrasonic parking sensors, causing the ADAS to miss an obstacle.
Mitigation Strategy: Implement multi-modal sensor fusion (LiDAR/Camera/Radar) to cross-verify sensor data.

Incident Description: Misconfigured S3 bucket exposed 10GB of vehicle telemetry data, including driver behavior and routes.
Mitigation Strategy: Enforce the Principle of Least Privilege (PoLP) and enable automated cloud configuration auditing.

Incident Description: Spoofed Tire Pressure Monitoring System signals triggered false low-pressure warnings to distract the driver.
Mitigation Strategy: Use encrypted TPMS protocols to prevent external signal fabrication.

Incident Description: Denial of Service (DoS) attack flooded the central gateway with high-priority CAN IDs, causing system-wide lag.
Mitigation Strategy: Implement traffic shaping and rate-limiting at the central gateway level.

Incident Description: Hardcoded API keys in the vehicle's companion Android app were extracted and used to access the owner's account.
Mitigation Strategy: Move sensitive keys to a Secure Vault and use runtime application self-protection (RASP).

Incident Description: Modification of the bootloader allowed an attacker to install a persistent rootkit in the Telematics Control Unit.
Mitigation Strategy: Enable Secure Boot with a Hardware Root of Trust to verify firmware at every power cycle.

Incident Description: Disgruntled employee uploaded a "logic bomb" to the production line, bricking ECUs during the final assembly phase.
Mitigation Strategy: Implement multi-party authorization for production code changes and monitor for anomalous uploads.

Incident Description: GPS signal interference caused the vehicle navigation to deviate from the planned route in an autonomous shuttle.
Mitigation Strategy: Use dead reckoning (IMU sensors) as a fallback when GPS signal-to-noise ratio is low.
